dct_title_s: The New York Times War Map
dct_description_sm: Prepared for the New York Times By C. S. Hammond & Co., 30 Church St., New York.
Shows railroads, boundaries, roads, principal wireless stations, waterways, canals, various fortifications, aircraft depots, cities.
Also shows battle lines (dated December 21 and 31 1917), and furthest German advance.
Versos include artwork and photos (portraits, trenches, troops, machinery, ceremonies, etc.), with textual descriptions.
Five sheets published in a series of Sunday papers from 30 December 1917 to 27 January 1918.
In top margins: "This map is drawn so that it can be put together with other sections to appear hereafter and to make a map 51x66 inches."
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Map Collections courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact Branner Earth Sciences Library & Map Collections at brannerlibrary@stanford.edu.
